passage_text: Full Definition of VITALITY. 1. a: the peculiarity distinguishing the living from the nonliving b: capacity to live and develop; also: physical or mental vigor especially when highly developed. 2. a: power of enduring b: lively and animated character. See vitality defined for English-language learners.

1. exuberant physical or mental vigor: a person of great vitality. 2. capacity for survival or for the continuation of a meaningful or purposeful existence: the vitality of an institution. 3. power to live or grow. 4. vital force or principle.

Free Dictionary. NOUN (4). 1. an energetic style; [syn: vitality, verve]2. a healthy capacity for vigorous activity; - Example: jogging works off my excess energy- Example: he seemed full of vim and vigor[syn: energy, vim, vitality]3.

The characteristic, principle, or force that distinguishes living things from nonliving things. 1  Physical or intellectual vigor; energy or liveliness. 2  The capacity to endure: the vitality of an old tradition.
Medical Definition of VITALITY. 1. : the peculiarity distinguishing the living from the nonliving. 2. : capacity to live and develop; also: physical or mental vigor especially when highly developed.
